madrid.name: Parque del Retiro
madrid.description: One of Madrid’s largest parks featuring gardens, boating lake and the iconic Crystal Palace.
madrid.details: Located in the heart of Madrid, Retiro Park offers over 125 hectares of peace and culture, featuring fountains, statues, exhibitions and a rowing lake.

madrid.name: Museo del Prado
madrid.description: World‑renowned art museum housing masterpieces by Goya, Velázquez and El Greco.
madrid.details: The Prado Museum contains one of the finest collections of European art, dating from the 12th century to the early 20th century.

madrid.name: Plaza Mayor
madrid.description: Historic grand square from the 17th century, surrounded by arcades and cafes.
madrid.details: A central plaza in Madrid, the Plaza Mayor is known for its symmetrical architecture and vibrant atmosphere.

madrid.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
madrid.description: Official residence of the Spanish Royal Family, featuring opulent rooms and stunning gardens.
madrid.details: The Royal Palace is the largest palace in Western Europe, showcasing a variety of historical artifacts, paintings, and tapestries.

madrid.name: Puerta del Sol
madrid.description: Iconic square at the heart of Madrid, known as the kilometer zero marker for Spanish roads.
madrid.details: Puerta del Sol is a bustling center of commerce, with historic landmarks and a major transport hub.

madrid.name: Templo de Debod
madrid.description: Ancient Egyptian temple relocated to Madrid, offering panoramic views of the city.
madrid.details: The Templo de Debod is an authentic Egyptian temple dating back to the 2nd century BC, offering visitors a glimpse into Egypt's rich history.

madrid.name: Plaza de Cibeles
madrid.description: Famous plaza with a monumental fountain, surrounded by grand buildings.
madrid.details: Plaza de Cibeles is one of Madrid's most recognizable landmarks, home to the Cibeles Fountain, a symbol of the city.

madrid.name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía
madrid.description: Museum showcasing modern and contemporary art, including Picasso's Guernica.
madrid.details: The Reina Sofía Museum is one of Spain's top cultural institutions, housing major works of modern art and temporary exhibitions.

madrid.name: El Rastro
madrid.description: Madrid’s most famous open-air flea market, perfect for shopping and exploring.
madrid.details: Every Sunday, El Rastro offers a vibrant marketplace where visitors can find antiques, clothing, and street food.

madrid.name: Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza
madrid.description: Art museum featuring a private collection of European paintings, from the Renaissance to modern art.
madrid.details: Located near the Prado Museum, the Thyssen-Bornemisza offers an extensive collection of over 1,000 works from various periods of art history.

madrid.name: Santiago Bernabéu Stadium
madrid.description: Iconic football stadium home to Real Madrid, offering tours and interactive experiences.
madrid.details: Santiago Bernabéu is a must-visit for football fans, featuring a museum and access to the stands and locker rooms.

madrid.name: Madrid Rio
madrid.description: Urban park along the Manzanares River, featuring green spaces, playgrounds, and cycling paths.
madrid.details: Madrid Rio is a perfect spot for outdoor activities, including walking, cycling, and enjoying nature.

madrid.name: Casa de Campo
madrid.description: Large park with a zoo, amusement park, and lake, ideal for a family day out.
madrid.details: Casa de Campo offers ample green space, a large lake for boating, and attractions like the Madrid Amusement Park and Zoo.

madrid.name: Gran Vía
madrid.description: Madrid’s most famous shopping street, lined with theaters, cinemas, and restaurants.
madrid.details: Gran Vía is a bustling thoroughfare with a variety of shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues.

barcelona.name: Sagrada Família
barcelona.description: Antoni Gaudí’s masterpiece – a still‑unfinished basilica with stunning architecture.
barcelona.details: An iconic symbol of Barcelona, the basilica is renowned for its elaborate facades and unique design blending Gothic and Art Nouveau forms.

barcelona.name: Park Güell
barcelona.description: Colorful park with Gaudí‑designed mosaic structures and panoramic views of the city.
barcelona.details: A UNESCO World Heritage Site filled with serpentine benches, colorful tile work, and architectural surprises across its scenic gardens.

barcelona.name: La Rambla
barcelona.description: Famous tree-lined street with shops, restaurants, and lively street performers.
barcelona.details: La Rambla is a bustling promenade that stretches from Plaça de Catalunya to the Christopher Columbus monument, full of life and color.

barcelona.name: Casa Batlló
barcelona.description: Gaudí-designed modernist building with colorful, wavy architecture and stunning interiors.
barcelona.details: Casa Batlló is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offering a surreal and imaginative interior that reflects Gaudí's unique vision.

barcelona.name: La Pedrera (Casa Milà)
barcelona.description: Another of Gaudí’s masterpieces, an apartment building with a unique, undulating stone facade.
barcelona.details: La Pedrera offers an insight into Gaudí’s organic style and features an impressive rooftop with chimneys that resemble sculptures.

barcelona.name: Barceloneta Beach
barcelona.description: Popular beach offering sun, sand, and a vibrant atmosphere along Barcelona’s coastline.
barcelona.details: Barceloneta Beach is one of the most iconic beaches in Barcelona, with a lively boardwalk, beach bars, and an excellent location near the city center.

barcelona.name: Montjuïc Hill
barcelona.description: Hilltop area featuring museums, gardens, and panoramic views of Barcelona.
barcelona.details: Montjuïc Hill offers a variety of attractions, including the Montjuïc Castle, the Magic Fountain, and several gardens and museums.

barcelona.name: Magic Fountain of Montjuïc
barcelona.description: Large fountain offering spectacular nightly light and music shows.
barcelona.details: Located at the foot of Montjuïc Hill, the Magic Fountain is a popular attraction where you can experience a colorful light display synchronized to music.

barcelona.name: Palau de la Música Catalana
barcelona.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this concert hall is a masterpiece of Modernist architecture.
barcelona.details: The Palau de la Música Catalana is known for its stunning stained glass, intricate mosaics, and exceptional acoustics.

barcelona.name: Camp Nou
barcelona.description: The famous football stadium and home to FC Barcelona, offering tours of the stadium and museum.
barcelona.details: Camp Nou is one of the largest football stadiums in the world, offering fans a chance to explore the museum and the stadium itself.

barcelona.name: Park de la Ciutadella
barcelona.description: Public park featuring a lake, gardens, and several museums.
barcelona.details: Located near the city center, the park is perfect for a peaceful stroll, a boat ride on the lake, or visiting the Barcelona Zoo and the Catalan Parliament.

barcelona.name: Tibidabo
barcelona.description: Amusement park with panoramic views of Barcelona from the top of a mountain.
barcelona.details: Tibidabo offers thrilling rides, an old-fashioned amusement park, and a church with sweeping views of the city and coastline.

barcelona.name: Palau Güell
barcelona.description: Another Gaudí-designed building, showcasing the unique style and creativity of the architect.
barcelona.details: Palau Güell is a magnificent example of Gaudí’s work, blending Art Nouveau with functional design and rich decoration.

barcelona.name: Barcelona Cathedral
barcelona.description: Gothic cathedral in the heart of Barcelona, known for its stunning architecture and impressive façade.
barcelona.details: The Cathedral of Barcelona, also known as the Cathedral of the Holy Cross, is one of the best examples of Gothic architecture in the city.

prague.name: Charles Bridge
prague.description: Iconic historic bridge lined with statues, offering views of Prague Castle.
prague.details: A pedestrian-only bridge from the 14th century featuring 30 baroque-style statues and connecting the Old Town with Prague Castle.

prague.name: Prague Castle
prague.description: Largest ancient castle complex in the world, with cathedral, museums and gardens.
prague.details: Dating back to the 9th century, Prague Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the Czech president.

prague.name: Old Town Square
prague.description: Historic square at the heart of Prague, featuring the Astronomical Clock and colorful buildings.
prague.details: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Old Town Square is surrounded by historic buildings, churches, and cafes, with the iconic Astronomical Clock located on the Town Hall.

prague.name: St. Vitus Cathedral
prague.description: Gothic cathedral located within Prague Castle, with beautiful stained glass windows and royal tombs.
prague.details: St. Vitus Cathedral is one of the most important landmarks in Prague, housing the tombs of Czech kings and a stunning collection of stained glass windows.

prague.name: Wenceslas Square
prague.description: Major square in Prague, home to historic landmarks and cultural venues.
prague.details: Wenceslas Square is a historic and modern commercial hub in Prague, known for its shops, restaurants, and historic buildings, including the National Museum.

prague.name: Prague Zoo
prague.description: One of the best zoos in Europe, featuring over 4,000 animals from around the world.
prague.details: Prague Zoo is located in a scenic area with diverse animal exhibits, including rare species and special enclosures like the Indonesian jungle.

prague.name: Petrin Hill
prague.description: A park with lush gardens, a funicular railway, and stunning views of Prague.
prague.details: Petrin Hill offers a peaceful retreat from the city, with gardens, a mirror maze, and the Petrin Lookout Tower offering panoramic views.

prague.name: John Lennon Wall
prague.description: Colorful graffiti wall symbolizing peace and love, inspired by John Lennon and the Beatles.
prague.details: The Lennon Wall is a famous site in Prague where messages of peace, love, and revolution are continually painted, reflecting the city's historical journey.

prague.name: Vltava River
prague.description: The longest river in the Czech Republic, offering boat rides and scenic views of Prague.
prague.details: The Vltava River runs through Prague, providing a picturesque setting for boat tours, bridges, and iconic landmarks like Charles Bridge.

prague.name: Vyšehrad
prague.description: A historic fortress offering views of Prague, with a park, basilica, and cemetery.
prague.details: Vyšehrad is a historic fort located above the Vltava River, offering visitors a quiet spot to enjoy gardens, explore the Basilica of St. Peter and Paul, and visit the Vyšehrad Cemetery.

prague.name: Prague Dancing House
prague.description: Modern, curvaceous building designed by Frank Gehry, resembling a dancing couple.
prague.details: Known as the ‘Dancing House,’ this architectural marvel by Frank Gehry is one of Prague’s most iconic modern buildings.

prague.name: National Museum
prague.description: Largest museum in the Czech Republic, with a vast collection of natural history, historical artifacts, and art.
prague.details: The National Museum houses millions of objects across several disciplines, including geology, archaeology, and art, offering an insight into Czech and world history.

prague.name: Letná Park
prague.description: A large park with sweeping views of Prague and the Vltava River, known for its giant metronome.
prague.details: Letná Park is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike, offering walking paths, gardens, and a giant metronome where a statue of Stalin once stood.

prague.name: Prague Astronomical Clock
prague.description: Famous medieval astronomical clock located in the Old Town Hall, showing time, astronomical data, and zodiac signs.
prague.details: The Prague Astronomical Clock is one of the oldest astronomical clocks still operational today, attracting visitors every hour for its hourly show.

rome.name: Colosseum
rome.description: Iconic Roman amphitheater known for gladiator battles and spectacular performances.
rome.details: The Colosseum is one of the greatest works of Roman architecture, offering a glimpse into ancient Rome's history and public spectacles.

rome.name: Vatican Museums
rome.description: World-famous museums, home to art collections, including the Sistine Chapel.
rome.details: The Vatican Museums boast thousands of years of art, featuring works by Michelangelo, Raphael, and many others.

rome.name: Pantheon
rome.description: Ancient Roman temple known for its impressive dome and oculus.
rome.details: The Pantheon, a masterpiece of Roman engineering, is one of the best-preserved ancient Roman buildings, now functioning as a church.

rome.name: Trevi Fountain
rome.description: Baroque fountain where visitors toss coins to ensure their return to Rome.
rome.details: The Trevi Fountain is the largest Baroque fountain in Rome, featuring sculptures of Neptune and other mythological figures.

rome.name: St. Peter's Basilica
rome.description: Renowned church located within Vatican City, famous for its architecture and Michelangelo's Pietà.
rome.details: St. Peter's Basilica is the largest church in the world, known for its stunning dome and as a center of Christian worship.

rome.name: Roman Forum
rome.description: Ancient marketplace and center of Roman political and social life.
rome.details: The Roman Forum is a sprawling ruin of temples, arches, and squares, once the center of ancient Rome's public life.

rome.name: Piazza Navona
rome.description: Baroque square with fountains, restaurants, and artists showcasing their work.
rome.details: Piazza Navona is one of Rome's most famous squares, home to Bernini's Fountain of the Four Rivers.

rome.name: Castel Sant'Angelo
rome.description: Castle-turned-museum with views of the city and the Tiber River.
rome.details: Originally a mausoleum for Emperor Hadrian, Castel Sant'Angelo is now a museum offering panoramic views of Rome.

rome.name: Borghese Gallery
rome.description: Art gallery housing works by Bernini, Caravaggio, and other Renaissance masters.
rome.details: The Borghese Gallery is one of Rome’s premier art museums, showcasing an extensive collection of Baroque and Renaissance art.

rome.name: Spanish Steps
rome.description: Famous staircase linking Piazza di Spagna with Trinità dei Monti church.
rome.details: The Spanish Steps are a popular landmark in Rome, leading up to the Trinità dei Monti church, with stunning views of the city.

rome.name: Campo de' Fiori
rome.description: Vibrant market square with vendors selling fresh produce, flowers, and local goods.
rome.details: Campo de' Fiori is one of Rome’s liveliest squares, especially in the morning when the market is in full swing.

rome.name: Villa Borghese Gardens
rome.description: Large public park offering peaceful walks, museums, and boat rentals.
rome.details: Villa Borghese is Rome's central park, with gardens, lakes, museums, and the Borghese Gallery.

rome.name: Trastevere
rome.description: Charming neighborhood known for narrow streets, medieval churches, and vibrant nightlife.
rome.details: Trastevere is one of Rome's most picturesque neighborhoods, filled with quaint squares, cobblestone streets, and lively cafes.

paris.name: Eiffel Tower
paris.description: Iconic Parisian landmark offering breathtaking views of the city.
paris.details: The Eiffel Tower is one of the most recognizable structures in the world, providing panoramic views of Paris from its observation decks.

paris.name: Louvre Museum
paris.description: World-famous art museum, home to the Mona Lisa and countless other masterpieces.
paris.details: The Louvre is the largest art museum in the world, housing works spanning thousands of years of history and culture.

paris.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
paris.description: Gothic cathedral known for its stunning architecture and historical significance.
paris.details: Notre-Dame is one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture, with its impressive stained glass windows and iconic towers.

paris.name: Montmartre
paris.description: Historic neighborhood famous for its bohemian atmosphere and the Sacré-Cœur Basilica.
paris.details: Montmartre is a picturesque hilltop area of Paris with narrow streets, art studios, and spectacular views of the city.

paris.name: Versailles Palace
paris.description: Extravagant royal palace with magnificent gardens, the residence of French kings.
paris.details: Versailles is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its opulent palace, stunning gardens, and the Hall of Mirrors.

paris.name: Arc de Triomphe
paris.description: Triumphal arch honoring those who fought and died during the French Revolution and Napoleonic Wars.
paris.details: The Arc de Triomphe stands at the top of the Champs-Élysées, providing a great view of the city from its rooftop.

paris.name: Seine River Cruises
paris.description: Relaxing boat tours along the Seine, offering stunning views of Paris landmarks.
paris.details: A Seine River Cruise is one of the best ways to see the city’s landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, and the Louvre.

paris.name: Pantheon Paris
paris.description: Historical monument and mausoleum housing the tombs of French luminaries.
paris.details: The Pantheon is a grand building that commemorates the great minds of France, including Voltaire and Rousseau.

paris.name: Champs-Élysées
paris.description: Famous avenue in Paris lined with shops, theaters, and cafés.
paris.details: The Champs-Élysées is known for its luxury boutiques, cultural venues, and its iconic view of the Arc de Triomphe.

paris.name: Luxembourg Gardens
paris.description: Elegant public gardens with fountains, sculptures, and the French Senate.
paris.details: The Luxembourg Gardens are a serene escape in Paris, offering picturesque landscapes, ponds, and stunning flowerbeds.

paris.name: Musée d'Orsay
paris.description: Museum housed in a former railway station, showcasing Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces.
paris.details: The Musée d'Orsay is home to works by Monet, Degas, and Van Gogh, offering a fantastic view of Paris from its clock tower.
